bug.short_desc: plugin doesn't appear under list of available plugins
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: The "Alternative Toolbar" plugin isn't listed in the Rhythmbox plugins window.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 0.17.3-4
How reproducible: Install rhythmbox-alternative-toolbar
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Run Rhythmbox 2. Select AppMenu -> Plugins
Actual results: There is no "Alternative Toolbar" plugin available.
Expected results: The "Alternative Toolbar" plugin to be in the list.
Additional info: I used to maintain this package in a COPR repo[1], and I just did a quick test against my COPR package. It *does* show up in the rhythmbox plugin window. I'm not sure what's different about the package being build in Fedora directly.
1: https://fedorapeople.org/cgit/linkdupont/public_git/rhythmbox-alternative-toolbar.git/

I was testing that package, I found that error when I use the noarch package, but it works well when I use some arched package, I will try to correct that error, thanks for the feedback.
Greetings.
